1. Scald the milk, add the sugar, salt, butter and lemon peel. Let cool slightly.
2. Sprinkle the yeast onto warm water and dissolve. Add to the milk mixture
4. Add 2 1/2 cups flour and mix until smooth
5. Add additional flour as needed to form the dough and knead for about 5-8 minutes until it is smooth and elastic.
6. Place dough in a lightly greased bowl. Cover and let rise in a warm area until doubled- about 1 hour
7. Punch down the dough and let rise again for an additional 30 minutes until doubled.
8 Divide dough into 4 parts. Roll into ropes and braid into 8 inch long loaves. Place colored egg on closed end. Brush with egg was and sprinkle with small colored confectionary balls
